case_title: Commissioner of Income-Tax vs S.R.M.T. Staff Association
judges: Syed Shah Mohammad Quadri, G. Bikshapathy
result: Reference answered in favor of the assessee and against the Revenue
legal_question: Whether the amount received by way of advertising charges are voluntary contributions or donations and are not trading receipts?

facts.tax_assessment: Income-tax Officer treated the amount as revenue receipts
facts.association_claim: Charitable institution and exemption from tax
facts.tribunal_decision: Amounts received were voluntary contributions or donations, not trading receipts

legal_arguments.revenue: Contributions should be treated as trading receipts, not donations, citing absence of charitable status.
legal_arguments.association: Receipts were voluntary contributions, not income, as the souvenir was published only once and not annually.

key_statutes.income_tax_act_section_2_clause_24: Definition of income including voluntary contributions

bombay_high_court_case.title: CIT v. Trustees of Visha Nima Charity Trust
bombay_high_court_case.decision: Contributions to a charitable trust were not income.

calcutta_high_court_case.title: Automobile Association of Bengal v. CIT
calcutta_high_court_case.decision: Absence of mutuality made advertisement charges taxable.

court_observations.charitable_status: The association was not a charitable institution.
court_observations.nature_of_contributions: Payments were voluntary contributions or donations, not trading receipts.

final_decision: Voluntary contributions received by the association cannot be treated as income or trading receipts.
